item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, April 13, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The Dark Side of the Moomins (149 points | 27 comments)
2. Skywork-OR1: new SOTA 32B thinking model with open weight (46 points | 4 comments)
3. Wasting Inferences with Aider (58 points | 32 comments)

5. Whenever – typed and DST-safe datetimes for Python (184 points | 79 comments)
6. Cargo-mutants:zombie: Inject bugs and see if your tests catch them (36 points | 4 comments)

8. Philip K. Dick: Stanisław Lem Is a Communist Committee (154 points | 70 comments)

12. Compute's Gazette Magazine Returns After 35 Yrs, Will Focus on Retro Computing (38 points | 11 comments)
13. Show HN: Chonky – a neural approach for text semantic chunking (112 points | 30 comments)

20. RNA interference and nanomedicine team up to fight dangerous fungal infections (12 points | discuss)
21. How to not build a two stage model rocket (100 points | 33 comments)
22. How I install personal versions of programs on Unix (31 points | 19 comments)
23. I ditched my laptop for a pocketable mini PC and a pair of AR glasses (268 points | 178 comments)
24. Emacs Lisp Elements (314 points | 46 comments)
25. Osprey – Browser extension that protects you from malicious websites (14 points | 8 comments)
26. Experimental release of GrapheneOS for Pixel 9a (315 points | 198 comments)
27. Cross-Entropy and KL Divergence (57 points | 8 comments)
28. Why is there a “small house” in IBM's Code page 437? (210 points | 47 comments)
29. Show HN: memEx, a personal knowledge base inspired by zettlekasten and org-mode (170 points | 39 comments)
30. Amazon Turned Drivers into First Responders in Europe Experiment (7 points | 2 comments)
